department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: Pacific Highway Port of Entry (POE) is the largest POE in western Canada. The POE processes passenger vehicles, commercial buses and commercial trucks.
description: The POE is a key gateway for the Pacific Northwest and connects to major commercial processing routes and key industry infrastructure including the marine Ports of Vancouver and Vancouver International Airport. As one of the busiest commercial POEs in Canada, new construction would facilitate future economic growth for Canada’s export/import industries.
full_summary:
Title
===============

EZ899-240854 RFI for Pacific Highway Land Border Crossing, Surrey, BC
----------------------------------------------------------------

### Tender Details

| Field        | Value                                |

| Reference    | WS4157185630-Doc4157338317          |

### Tender Status

The tender status for this procurement opportunity is expired.

### Industry

* Architectural engineering
* Building construction management

### Procurement

* Competitive open bidding
* No trade agreements or limited tendering reasons applicable

### Location

* Canada
* British Columbia

### Lead Agency

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is the contracting entity for this procurement opportunity.

### Interested Parties

This request for information is directed towards interested parties, including:
* Indigenous communities
* The local business community
* Industry stakeholders

### Purpose

The purpose of this request for information is to gather information and interest in the planned project for the redeveloping and modernizing the Pacific Highway Port of Entry. This will include:
* Notifying stakeholders of this planned project
* Initiating an industry and community consultative process
* Providing stakeholders the opportunity to meet and discuss partnering, sub-contracting, and skills development

### Event Description

A community and industry engagement event will be scheduled to provide stakeholders the opportunity to meet and discuss partnering, sub-contracting, and skills development. This event will take place with the following details:

* Date
* Time
* Location (TBD)

### Contact Information

The contact person for this procurement opportunity is:
* Name: Donna Fung (SPAC/PSPC)
* Email: donna.fung@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* Telephone: (not provided)
* Fax: (not provided)
